column4: in safe mode, I'm trying to add a new user.  It creates the user and a group and home and then says "operation not permitted".  Then it removes the changes.  Any help?
not mounted / ro is it ?
- I don't understand.
try   sudo mount -o remount,rw / ;sudo adduser <name>
- I get help information about mounting, then the adduser part does the same as before.
what error does adduser give ?
chown 1000:1000 /home/raindog:  Operation not permitted.
yeah you have an vfat partition mounted on /home don't you ?
I just installed and haven't logged into the shell yet.  I resized a ntfs partition and added an ext3, fat32, and swap partitions.
do this for me.     mount | grep /home   and show me what it says
/dev/hda6/ on /home type vfat (rw)
is there a fix?
did I make a mistake while adding the new partitions?
yeah  sudo umount /home && sudo adduser    then edit your fstab to mount that partition some place else.
that seems to have done the job.  Thank you very much for your help and patience.  As you can tell I have a lot to learn.
example   sudo nano /etc/fstab      change the line that says  /home   to /home/<new users name>/fat32   save and exit nano    then  mkdir /home/<user>/fat32    and reboot.
didn't do the fstab party yet.
just a thought.   you did set a food passwd for that new user didn't you?   being uid 1000 it will have sudo root access to everything.
a "good"  password?   yes.  ONce I can get into the gui I can change the access level of that user(me) correct?
the first user is added to group admin  which unless you edit sudoers has full root access to the system via sudo
first user account is the admin account.
